metadata.title: CVE-2021-4209 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in GnuTLS. As Nettle's hashupdate functions internally call memcpy, providing zero-length input maycause undefined behavior. This flaw leads to a denial of service afterauthentication in rare circumstances.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4209` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnutls-bin - 3.7.3-4ubuntu1
guile-gnutls - 3.7.3-4ubuntu1
libgnutls-dane0 - 3.7.3-4ubuntu1
libgnutls-openssl27 - 3.7.3-4ubuntu1
libgnutls30 - 3.7.3-4ubuntu1
libgnutlsxx28 - 3.7.3-4ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnutls28 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.7.3-4ubuntu1').
